Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed with traces of faded added white decoration, possibly a lotus flower; exterior: painted decoration (fired red) consisting of leg and underbelly of feline, to left; rosette as filling ornament; surface partly chipped.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Group of Light-Walled Naukratis Animal Chalices. All sherds in this group are small and offer very little by way of information beyond the fact that they come from light-walled chalices. The decoration on sherds belonging to this group is also poorly or carelessly drawn (Lemos 1991, 93).
The piece has a relatively thick wall and the glaze is unusually glossy for Chian work.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 93, p. 254, no. 435)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. V, no. 48)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0522) (phase 2)
